benchmark_details.name: FAIRGAMER
benchmark_details.overview: FAIRGAMER is the first bias evaluation benchmark for LLMs in video game scenarios, designed to evaluate social/cultural biases exhibited by LLMs and their impact on game balance through six specific tasks and a novel evaluation metric, Decision Log Standard Deviation (Dlstd).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and quantify the social/cultural biases of LLMs and their direct effects on game balance within video game contexts.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: FAIRGAMER Benchmark provides valuable insights into LLM biases but has limitations including limited data coverage focusing on a small number of representative games.

data.source: Data collected from 58 Steam games encompassing both real-world and fully fictional game content.
data.annotation: Data structured around six tasks to evaluate biases in LLMs interactions in games.

methodology.calculation: The Dlstd metric is calculated based on the variance of decision distributions in LLM outputs to quantify bias.
methodology.interpretation: A higher Dlstd indicates greater bias among different entities, resulting in poorer game balance or unreasonable difficulty levels.
methodology.baseline_results: Experiments evaluated eight state-of-the-art models, revealing various degrees of bias across tasks.
methodology.validation: Extensive testing across multiple models and scenarios to ensure reliable measurement of LLM biases.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark includes demographic analysis across different race and career categories with varying discount offerings.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential impacts of LLM biases may lead to unfair advantages or disadvantages in competitive gaming scenarios.
